Content: we usually just spin up a new assetchain via -ac_name= and other -ac parameters

Content: not sure if the actual testnet is still working

Author: johnjeg#6092
Content: We want to support the new sapling transaction in the Coinomi wallet and it can be done by re-implementing the transaction format and signatures. We cannot just update the nodes, the actual clients need to be updated.

Content: the hard fork being few days from now, presents problems for us

Content: it is the same transaction format as for ZEC

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
`we usually just spin up a new assetchain via -ac_name= and other -ac parameters`
@johnjeg what he's saying is that you can fire up 2 nodes with any params you want and freely test
`komodod -ac_name=COINOMITEST  -ac_supply=1000000 -gen`
should be good enough to do whatever you need for KMD transactions

Content: @jl777c I know that it's the same tx format. There are some params though: SAPLING_BRANCH_ID and SAPLING_VERSION_GROUP_ID

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: same

Author: johnjeg#6092
Content: also what is the SAPLING_MAINNET_ACTIVATION_HEIGHT?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
**Sapling activated test chain**
edit `~/komodo/src/komodo_defs.h` with the following and compile the daemon
```
#define KOMODO_SAPLING_ACTIVATION 1543073054 // Sat, 24 Nov 2018 15:24:14 GMT
#define KOMODO_SAPLING_DEADLINE 1543593600 // Fri, 30 Nov 2018 16:00:00 GMT
```
chain start:
```
./komodod -ac_name=SPLTEST -ac_supply=5555555 -ac_reward=10000000000000 -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -addnode=54.36.126.42 -addnode=94.130.224.11 &
```
Explorer: http://spltest.explorer.dexstats.info/

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we wont know the height until 1am Dec 15th, it uses a timestamp trigger that is mapped to a height

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
static constexpr uint32_t SAPLING_VERSION_GROUP_ID = 0x892F2085;
const uint32_t SAPLING_BRANCH_ID = 0x76b809bb;

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: minimal changes from zcash to simplify integration

Author: johnjeg#6092
Content: timestamp is 1544835600?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is the trigger timestamp. it goes backwards 30 blocks, scans from there the earliest transition across that timestamp and then adds 60 blocks to that, so it will end up around 1am

Content: to adding it again
